result.execSummary:
All charges against David L Weiland in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David L Weiland is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant regarding:  bail refund.  (David L. Weiland - #502632, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).

Defendant David L Weiland not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for David L Weiland.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. State's essential witness is NOT present in court, therefore, the State is unable to proceed today.  No alternative theory.  Motion to dismiss by the defense argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Case dismissed without prejudice.  The defendant is released from all conditions of bail.

Defendant David L Weiland not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for David L Weiland.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Parties advise prepared for trial. Court passes case to address other jury trial calls.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant David L Weiland not in court, in custody.  Student Intern Kyle Elderkin under the supervision of AttorneyAmanda Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Final pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Jury trial first call 08-29-2022 at 9:00 am, Branch 2.
Letter from defendant re:  revocation of bail.  (David L. Weiland - #502632, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant David L Weiland not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

22RM026843  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/20/2022 sa

Defendant David L Weiland in court with Attorney Fred Richardson. Daivd Weiland in custody  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Esparza.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GFO, 2000 W. Lincoln Ave., Milwaukee, WI

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant David L Weiland in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant David L Weiland in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David L Weiland appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
